page.title: 01BEWCASTLE - A GENERAL VIEW
page.content: The area of the survey is a rather remote rural region some 20 miles north-east of Carlisle, the north-east corner of Cumbria with borders to Scotland and Northumberland.The area is upland, ranging in height from 400 feet above sea level to some 900 feet. The roads are quiet lanes with little through traffic and is still off the tourist map.Most of the farming is stock-rearing, sheep and beef cattle being the main sources of income.The only crops grown are hay and silage.Services to the region are as one would expect, no bus, no gas, no street-lighting.
